entry.title: Fifteen children from Gaza to receive urgent medical care in Spain
entry.summary:
Sixteen people from Gaza with complicated medical conditions will arrive in Spain today to receive care there, through an evacuation process involving the World Health Organization (WHO) and multiple partners. Fifteen of them are children, ranging in age from 3 to 17 years old. The mother of one of the children will also be treated in Spain. The patients had been in hospital in Egypt for the past several months, after evacuating from Gaza. They are a small portion of the thousands of other children and adults who need access to specialized medical care outside of Gaza.
“These very sick children will be getting the care they need thanks to cooperation between several partners and countries,” said Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, WHO Director-General. “We are immensely grateful for the suppo…

entry.title: Norther Ireland GPC elects new chair
entry.summary: The new chair of the BMA’s Northern Ireland GP committee has said she wants to ‘bring more women onto the committee’ and into leadership roles within the union. Armagh GP partner Dr Frances O’Hagan was elected to succeed Dr Alan Stout, who chaired his last meeting of the committee earlier this month after six years The post Norther Ireland GPC elects new chair appeared first on Pulse Today.

entry.title: Royal Bolton Hospital provides noise-cancelling headphones for patients
entry.summary: Royal Bolton Hospital has introduced noise-cancelling headphones for patients with learning disabilities to help support them in loud and busy environments.

entry.title: Transfers of care toolkit
entry.summary: Professional Record Standards Body - High volumes of patients are transferred every day between health and care settings. This toolkit concentrates on the PRSB eDischarge Summary Standard, which specifies the data to be shared between secondary and primary care to support the discharge of a patient from hospitals across the UK. It does not propose a one-size-fits-all approach and recognises...

entry.title: NHS England statement on industrial action: Friday, 28 June
entry.summary: Professor Sir Stephen Powis, NHS National Medical Director, said: “With industrial action set to cause widespread disruption this weekend, and the NHS seeing record levels of patients in recent months, we urge the public to help us by using services as they normally would. “Everyone can also help by taking steps to keep themselves and others […]

entry.title: How GPs plan to vote in the 2024 general election
entry.summary: A GPonline poll ahead of next week's general election shows there has been a sharp drop in support from GPs for the Conservative Party since 2019.

entry.title: One person confirmed to have died from E. coli outbreak
entry.summary: One person has died from the E. coli outbreak, now linked to sandwich lettuce, the UK Health Security Agency has confirmed. In an update, the UKHSA said there had been a further 19 cases associated with the outbreak of STEC O145 in the past week bringing the total to 275. entry.title: GPC negotiators will not accept another multi-year contract deal, says chair
entry.summary: The BMA’s GP Committee England will not accept another multi-year contract deal with the Government ‘anytime now’, its chair has said. Speaking at an online roadshow yesterday evening, Dr Katie Bramall-Stainer said that the five-year pay deal – which provided a 2% year-on-year funding rise from 2019-2024 – had contributed to pay erosion for partners The post GPC negotiators will not accept another multi-year contract deal, says chair appeared first on Pulse Today.

entry.title: Movers and Shakers news roundup
entry.summary: Our latest Movers and Shakers roundup features new chief executives for trusts in west London, Warrington and Halton, and Greater Manchester.

entry.title: Increased primary care funding needed to address NHS crisis, report says
entry.summary: Increasing funding for primary and community care should be a key priority for the next government if it wants to reduce hospital waits, meet performance targets and build a more sustainable NHS, according to a new report.

entry.title: Streeting promises urgent post-election talks to improve GP working conditions
entry.summary: Shadow health and social care secretary Wes Streeting has said a new Labour government would look to improve GP working conditions 'as quickly as possible' if it wins the general election next week.

entry.title: Junior doctors break strike to assist at sites hit by cyber attack
entry.summary: Guy’s and St Thomas’ and King’s College Hospital NHS Foundation Trusts continue to experience major disruption following the cyber attack on Synnovis.

entry.title: Podcast: Wes Streeting on Labour’s plans for general practice
entry.summary: Talking General Practice speaks to Labour’s shadow health and social care secretary Wes Streeting about the party’s plans for general practice if it wins next week’s general election.
